summary: The 'Ban Corporate PACs Act' amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to limit the authority of corporations to establish and operate separate segregated funds for political purposes.  It restricts this authority to nonprofit corporations, as defined by section 501(c) of the Internal Revenue Code, excluding those ineligible for tax exemptions if they establish such a fund. It also restricts solicitation of contributions and alters the treatment of government contractors. The Act includes an effective date and a transition period for existing funds.
